required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Readmissions of Lung Transplant Patients in ICU.
clinical_study.official_title: Readmissions of Lung Transplant Patients in the Intensive Care Unit

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

clinical_study.source: Hospital Universitari Vall d'Hebron Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock:
A multi-centre, prospective and observational study was carried out from August 2012 to June 2016 in five Spanish tertiary-care university hospitals with well-established lung transplant programs: Vall d'Hebron (Barcelona), Marqués de Valdecilla (Santander), 12 de Octubre (Madrid), CHUAC (A Coruña), and Reina Sofía (Córdoba).
The study population comprised all consecutive adult lung transplant recipients who required ICUr (after >7 days post-transplant discharge from ICU) during august 2012 - June 2016 (4-yr period).

primary_outcome.measure: Causes of ICU readmission in LT adults
primary_outcome.description: To assess the principal causes of ICU readmission in LT adults.

primary_outcome.measure: Predictors of ICU and hospital mortality.
primary_outcome.description: To identify potential predictors of ICU and hospital mortality.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Lung transplant patients readmitted in ICU

intervention.arm_group_label: Lung transplant patients readmitted in ICU

study_pop.textblock: Lung transplant recipients who required ICU readmission.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All consecutive adult lung transplant recipients who required ICU readmission (after >7 days post-transplant discharge from ICU) during august 2012 - June 2016 (4-yr period).
Exclusion Criteria:
- ICU readmission < 8 days post-transplant discharge from ICU.
- ICU readmission for early postoperative care following lung transplantation.
